sen.j: 皇典講究所（こうてんこうきゅうじょ 1882年 - 1946年）は、日本に設置された神道の研究・教育機関である。
sen.e: Koten Kokyujo (1882 - 1946) was an institute established in Japan for the research and education on Shinto.
Koten Kokyujo (1882 - 1946) was an institute established in Japan for the research and education on Shinto.
Koten Kokyujo (1882 - 1946) was an institute established in Japan for the research and education on Shinto.

sen.j: 1867年（明治元年）に大教宣布が発布され、1876年（明治9年）に神道事務局に生徒寮を設置して神職の養成に力を注いだ明治新政府であったが、政教分離・信教の自由論が世の中に広まり、教導職制が廃止された。
sen.e: Following Taikyo-senpu (propagation of the Great Teaching of Shinto) in 1867, the newly established Meiji Government was enthusiastic about the training of Shinto priests, establishing a dormitory for the trainees under the Shinto Jimukyoku (the Secretariat of Shinto), but the Kyodoshoku-sei (a system of national enlightenment on Shinto through government-assigned preceptors) had to be discontinued as the voices calling for the separation of religion and politics and the freedom of religion prevailed.
sen.cmt: 「教導職制」という用語の背景説明がないとこの部分は理解されないと思い、補足説明を加えました。
sen.e: Following Taikyo-senpu (propagation of the Great Teaching of Shinto) in 1867, the newly established Meiji Government was enthusiastic about the training of Shinto priests, establishing a dormitory for the trainees under the Shinto Jimukyoku (the Secretariat of Shinto), but the Kyodoshoku-sei (a system of national enlightenment on Shinto through government-assigned preceptors) had to be discontinued as the voices calling for the separation of religion and politics and the freedom of religion prevailed.

Following Taikyo-senpu (propagation of the Great Teaching of Shinto) in 1867, the newly established Meiji Government was enthusiastic about the training of Shinto priests, establishing a dormitory for the trainees under the Shinto Jimukyoku (the Secretariat of Shinto), but the Kyodoshoku-sei (a system of national enlightenment on Shinto through government-assigned preceptors) had to be discontinued as the voices calling for the separation of religion and politics and the freedom of religion prevailed.

sen.j: それに伴い神道事務局の中では、旧典練習所をより発展させた機関を設置する必要があるとの考えが強くなっていた。
sen.e: Consequently an idea has gained strength within the Shinto Jimukyoku that it would be necessary to establish a new institution which has a wider range of functions and roles of 旧典練習所.
sen.cmt: 「旧典練習所」は読み、意味、定訳いずれも不明です。ウェブ検索では本主題にからむ表記（表現がみな同じ）以外に見当たりません。読みはおそらく「きゅうてんれんしゅうじょ」でいいと思われますが、ローマ字表記にしても意味をなさないと考え、漢字のままにしてあります。
sen.e: Consequently an idea has gained strength within the Shinto Jimukyoku that it would be necessary to establish a new institution which has a wider range of functions and roles of Kyuten Renshujo (the training institute of ancient national literature).
sen.cmt: 読みをローマ字表記して、説明括弧を補足しました。
sen.e: Consequently an idea has gained strength within the Shinto Jimukyoku that it would be necessary to establish a new institution which has a wider range of functions and roles of Kyuten Renshujo (the training institute of ancient national literature).

sen.j: この大教宣布の不振、それに続く祭神論争によりその教学の未成熟さを実感した神道はその教学の深化に迫られ、1882年（明治15年）8月23日に、有栖川宮幟仁親王の令旨を奉じた山田顕義ら内務省 (日本)官僚と、松野勇雄ら数名の国文学者が「専ら国典を講究するため」として研究機関を設立した。
sen.e: Standing in need of reinforcing the Shinto teaching, which became clear through the stagnant Taikyo-senpu and the subsequent pantheon dispute, some bureaucrats of the Ministry of Home Affairs including Akiyoshi YAMADA and several scholars of Japanese literature such as Isao MATSUNO established a research institute 'purely for the purpose of an in-depth study of the national literature' in obedience to an order of His Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Takahito.
sen.cmt: 原文前半部分では「神道」が主語になっていますが、そのまま訳すと意味をなさないと考えました。かといってこの「神道」が具体的に何を指すのか（単に「神道関係者」などと解釈していいものかどうか）判然としません。そこで後半部分の「設立当事者」を全文の主語として訳してあります。
sen.e: Standing in need of reinforcing the Shinto teaching, which became clear through the stagnant Taikyo-senpu and the subsequent pantheon dispute, some bureaucrats of the Ministry of Home Affairs including Akiyoshi YAMADA and several scholars of Japanese literature such as Isao MATSUNO established a research institute 'purely for the purpose of an in-depth study of the national literature' in obedience to an order of His Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Takahito.

Standing in need of reinforcing the Shinto teaching, which became clear through the stagnant Taikyo-senpu and the subsequent pantheon dispute, some bureaucrats of the Ministry of Home Affairs including Akiyoshi YAMADA and several scholars of Japanese literature such as Isao MATSUNO established a research institute 'purely for the purpose of an in-depth study of the national literature' in obedience to an order of His Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Takahito.

sen.j: 内務省 (日本)の委託を受けて神職を育成を行ったほか、各種の講演会、『古事類苑』・『延喜式』の編纂事業を行った。
sen.e: The institute carried out the training of Shinto priests on behalf of the Ministry of Home Affairs, and additionally, engaged itself in organizing lecture meetings of various kinds and compiling "Kojiruien" (Encyclopedia of Ancient Matters) and "Engishiki" (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).
sen.cmt: 『延喜式』の編纂は平安時代に行われており、原文の意味するところがよくわかりません。とりあえず、そのまま訳しましたが、原文の著者の意図を確認する必要があると思われます。
sen.e: The institute carried out the training of Shinto priests on behalf of the Ministry of Home Affairs, and additionally, engaged itself in organizing lecture meetings of various kinds and compiling "Kojiruien" (Encyclopedia of Ancient Matters) and "Engishiki" (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

The institute carried out the training of Shinto priests on behalf of the Ministry of Home Affairs, and additionally, engaged itself in organizing lecture meetings of various kinds and compiling "Kojiruien" (Encyclopedia of Ancient Matters) and "Engishiki" (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

sen.j: 後に國學院大學の設立経営を行う。
sen.e: Later Kokugakuin University was established and managed by the institute.
Later Kokugakuin University was established and managed by the institute.
Later Kokugakuin University was established and managed by the institute.

sen.j: また、日本大学も源流は皇典講究所に付属していた夜間部の法律学校に由来し、その日本大学から近畿大学が分離している。
sen.e: Also, Nihon University derives its origin from the law school in the evening session of Koten Kokyujo, and separated from Nihon University was Kinki University.
Also, Nihon University derives its origin from the law school in the evening session of Koten Kokyujo, and separated from Nihon University was Kinki University.
Also, Nihon University derives its origin from the law school in the evening session of Koten Kokyujo, and separated from Nihon University was Kinki University.

sen.j: 第2次世界大戦敗戦後の1946年（昭和21年）1月25日に連合国軍最高司令官総司令部による圧迫を受けて解散、事業と資産は学校法人國學院大學と神社本庁に継承されている。
sen.e: On January 25, 1946, following the defeat in World War II, Koken Kokyujo was dissolved under pressure from the General Headquarters, the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, and its business and assets were handed over to the school corporation Kokugakuin University and Jinja Honcho (the Association of Shinto Shrines).

On January 25, 1946, following the defeat in World War II, Koken Kokyujo was dissolved under pressure from the General Headquarters, the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, and its business and assets were handed over to the school corporation Kokugakuin University and Jinja Honcho (the Association of Shinto Shrines).

On January 25, 1946, following the defeat in World War II, Koken Kokyujo was dissolved under pressure from the General Headquarters, the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, and its business and assets were handed over to the school corporation Kokugakuin University and Jinja Honcho (the Association of Shinto Shrines).

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1882年 研究機関として発足、同時に教育機関としての役目も担う。
sen.e: 1882: Established as a research institute with a role of an educational institute as well.
1882: Established as a research institute with a role of an educational institute as well.
1882: Established as a research institute with a role of an educational institute as well.

sen.j: 3府40県に皇典講究所分所が設置される。
sen.e: Branches of Koten Kokyujo were established in 43 prefectures (3 fu's and 40 ken's)
Branches of Koten Kokyujo were established in 43 prefectures (3 main prefectures and 40 prefectures)
sen.cmt: 府と県はどちらもprefectureとなるので、府をmain prefectures としました。
sen.e: Branches of Koten Kokyujo were established in 43 prefectures (3 main prefectures and 40 prefectures)

sen.j: 1885年 第1回卒業式を挙行
sen.e: 1885: The first graduation ceremony was held.
1885: The first graduation ceremony was held.
1885: The first graduation ceremony was held.

sen.j: 1888年 補充中学校（現・東京都立戸山高等学校）を設立
sen.e: 1888: Hoju Chugakko (a supplementary junior high school, the present Tokyo Metropolitan Toyama Senior High School) was established.
1888: Hoju Chugakko (a supplementary junior high school, the present Tokyo Metropolitan Toyama Senior High School) was established.
1888: Hoju Chugakko (a supplementary junior high school, the present Tokyo Metropolitan Toyama Senior High School) was established.

sen.j: 1889年 夜間に日本法律学校（現・日本大学）を設立。
sen.e: 1889: Nihon Law School (the present Nihon University) was established in the evening session.
1889: Nihon Law School (the present Nihon University) was established in the evening session.
1889: Nihon Law School (the present Nihon University) was established in the evening session.

sen.j: 1890年 学校法人國學院大學を設立。
sen.e: 1890: The School Corporation Kokugakuin University was established.
1890: The School Corporation Kokugakuin University was established.
1890: The School Corporation Kokugakuin University was established.

sen.j: 補充中学校を共立中学校に改称
sen.e: Hoju Chugakko was renamed Kyoritsu Junior High School
Hoju Chugakko was renamed Kyoritsu Junior High School
Hoju Chugakko was renamed Kyoritsu Junior High School

sen.j: 1893年 國學院の第1回卒業式を挙行
sen.e: 1893: The first graduation ceremony of Kokugakuin University was held.
1893: The first graduation ceremony of Kokugakuin University was held.
1893: The first graduation ceremony of Kokugakuin University was held.

sen.j: 1894年 共立中学校を城北中学校と改称し、東京府へ移管させる
sen.e: 1894: Kyoritsu Junior High School was renamed Johoku Junior High School and its jurisdiction was moved to Tokyo-fu government.
1894: Kyoritsu Junior High School was renamed Johoku Junior High School and its jurisdiction was moved to Tokyo prefectural government.
1894: Kyoritsu Junior High School was renamed Johoku Junior High School and its jurisdiction was moved to Tokyo prefectural government.

sen.j: 1898年 財団法人皇典講究所として認可、國學院を財団法人國學院として分離、日本法律学校を財団法人日本法律学校として分離
sen.e: 1898: The institute was authorized as the incorporated foundation Koten Kokyujo, and Kokugakuin and Nihon Law School were separated as the incorporated foundation Kokugakuin and the incorporated foundation Nihon Law School respectively.

1898: The institute was authorized as the incorporated foundation Koten Kokyujo, and Kokugakuin and Nihon Law School were separated as the incorporated foundation Kokugakuin and the incorporated foundation Nihon Law School respectively.

1898: The institute was authorized as the incorporated foundation Koten Kokyujo, and Kokugakuin and Nihon Law School were separated as the incorporated foundation Kokugakuin and the incorporated foundation Nihon Law School respectively.

sen.j: 1899年 内務省 (日本)より神職養成事業を委託される
sen.e: 1899: Business of training Shinto priests was assigned to the institute.
1899: Business of training Shinto priests was assigned to the institute.
1899: Business of training Shinto priests was assigned to the institute.

sen.j: 1900年 禮典調査会を設置
sen.e: 1900: Reiten Chosakai (a board of investigation on rituals) was established.
1900: Reiten Chosakai (a board of investigation on rituals) was established.
1900: Reiten Chosakai (a board of investigation on rituals) was established.

sen.j: 1902年 師範部の学科を国語・漢文・歴史科とする
sen.e: 1902: 3 courses were set up under Teachers Department, namely Japanese, Chinese and History.
1902: 3 courses were set up under Teachers Department, namely Japanese, Chinese and History.
1902: 3 courses were set up under Teachers Department, namely Japanese, Chinese and History.

sen.j: 1904年 旧制専門学校の認可を得る
sen.e: 1904: The institute was approved as a vocational school under the prewar education system.
1904: The institute was approved as a vocational school under the prewar education system.
1904: The institute was approved as a vocational school under the prewar education system.

sen.j: 1909年 神職養成部を設置
sen.e: 1909: Shinto Priest Training Department was established
1909: Shinto Priest Training Department was established
1909: Shinto Priest Training Department was established

sen.j: 1919年 道義科を設置。
sen.e: 1919: Ethics course was set up.
1919: Ethics course was set up.
1919: Ethics course was set up.

sen.j: 1921年 大学部を廃止
sen.e: 1921: Daigaku-bu (the university department) was abolished.
1921: Daigaku-bu (the university department) was abolished.
1921: Daigaku-bu (the university department) was abolished.

sen.j: 1923年 國學院大學とともに澁谷氷川裏御料地に移転
sen.e: 1923: Relocated to Hikawaura goryochi (an Imperial estate) in Shibuya together with Kokugakuin University
1923: Relocated to Hikawaura goryochi (an Imperial estate) in Shibuya together with Kokugakuin University
1923: Relocated to Hikawaura goryochi (an Imperial estate) in Shibuya together with Kokugakuin University

sen.j: 1927年 専門学校令により附属神職部を設置。
sen.e: 1927: An auxiliary Shinto-priest Department was established in accordance with the Vocational School Ordinance.
sen.cmt: 附属神職部の定訳不明につきauxiliary Shinto-priest Departmentは仮訳です。
sen.e: 1927: An auxiliary Shinto-priest Department was established in accordance with the Vocational School Ordinance.
1927: An auxiliary Shinto-priest Department was established in accordance with the Vocational School Ordinance.

sen.j: 高等師範部を4年制として一部・二部に分置
sen.e: A four-year course Koto-shihan-bu (advanced teacher's department) was set up in each of the first and the second division.
sen.cmt: ウェブ上に見られる早稲田大学の歴史などをもとに、一部、二部は科目別divisionを意味するものとし、昼間、夜間という解釈にはしていません。
sen.e: A four-year course Koto-shihan-bu (advanced teacher's department) was set up in each of the first and the second division.
A four-year course Koto-shihan-bu (advanced teacher's department) was set up in each of the first and the second division.

sen.j: 1929年 神職部を神道部に改称
sen.e: 1929: Shinshoku-bu (Shinto-priest Department) was renamed Shinto-bu (Shinto Department).
1929: Shinshoku-bu (Shinto-priest Department) was renamed Shinto-bu (Shinto Department).
1929: Shinshoku-bu (Shinto-priest Department) was renamed Shinto-bu (Shinto Department).

sen.j: 1936年 神道部を4年制とする。
sen.e: 1936: Shinto-bu was made a four-year course.
1936: Shinto-bu was made a four-year course.
1936: Shinto-bu was made a four-year course.

sen.j: 1940年 興亜部を設置
sen.e: 1940: Koa-bu (Asian development department) was established.
1940: Koa-bu (Asian development department) was established.
1940: Koa-bu (Asian development department) was established.

sen.j: 1944年 神道部・高等師範部・興亜部を合併し、3年制専門部とする。
sen.e: 1944: Shinto-bu, Koto-shihan-bu and Koa-bu were merged into a 3-year course Senmon-bu (specialty department)
1944: Shinto-bu, Koto-shihan-bu and Koa-bu were merged into a 3-year course Senmon-bu (specialty department)
1944: Shinto-bu, Koto-shihan-bu and Koa-bu were merged into a 3-year course Senmon-bu (specialty department)

sen.j: 國學研究所を設置
sen.e: Kokugaku Kenkyusho (Institute of Japanese Studies) was established.
Kokugaku Kenkyusho (Institute of Japanese Studies) was established.
Kokugaku Kenkyusho (Institute of Japanese Studies) was established.

sen.j: 1946年 連合国軍最高司令官総司令部の指導により軍国主義の温床として解散、人員や財産は財団法人國學院大學が吸収
sen.e: 1946: Koten Kokyujo was defined as a hotbed of militarism by, and dissolved under the guidance of, the General Headquarters, the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, and its staff and assets were absorbed by the Incorporated Foundation Kokugakuin University.

1946: Koten Kokyujo was defined as a hotbed of militarism by, and dissolved under the guidance of, the General Headquarters, the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, and its staff and assets were absorbed by the Incorporated Foundation Kokugakuin University.

1946: Koten Kokyujo was defined as a hotbed of militarism by, and dissolved under the guidance of, the General Headquarters, the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, and its staff and assets were absorbed by the Incorporated Foundation Kokugakuin University.

sen.j: 1955年 國學院大學日本文化研究所が設置され、皇典講究所の研究を承継。
sen.e: 1955: Institute for Japanese Culture and Classics, Kokugakuin University was established, which inherited the researches of Koten Kokyujo.
1955: Institute for Japanese Culture and Classics, Kokugakuin University was established, which inherited the researches of Koten Kokyujo.
1955: Institute for Japanese Culture and Classics, Kokugakuin University was established, which inherited the researches of Koten Kokyujo.

sen.j: 1985年 國學院大學・日本大学が共同で皇典講究所跡地（千代田区飯田橋3－5－5 東京区政会館前）に発祥記念碑を建立。
sen.e: 1985: A foundation monument was established at the site of Koten Kokyujo (in front of Tokyo Kusei Kaikan building, 3-5-5 Iidabashi, Chiyoda-ku) jointly by Kokugakuin University and Nihon University.
1985: A foundation monument was established at the site of Koten Kokyujo (in front of Tokyo Kusei Kaikan building, 3-5-5 Iidabashi, Chiyoda-ku) jointly by Kokugakuin University and Nihon University.
1985: A foundation monument was established at the site of Koten Kokyujo (in front of Tokyo Kusei Kaikan building, 3-5-5 Iidabashi, Chiyoda-ku) jointly by Kokugakuin University and Nihon University.

sen.j: 2006年 特許庁により学校法人國學院大學の『皇典講究所』の商標登録が認可される。
sen.e: 2006: The School Corporation Kokugakuin University was granted a trade mark right by Japan Patent Office for the use of the term "Koten Kokyujo."
2006: The School Corporation Kokugakuin University was granted a trade mark right by Japan Patent Office for the use of the term "Koten Kokyujo."
